tit.e: Kuredake no dai (Wu Chinese bamboo in the eastern garden of Seiryoden)
tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。
tit.e: Kuredake no dai (Wu Chinese bamboo in the eastern garden of Seiryoden)

sen.j: 呉竹の台（くれたけのだい）は、清涼殿の東庭の北寄りの、呉竹を植えた所である。
sen.e: Kuretake no dai where planting Wu Chinese bamboo in the eastern garden of Seiryoden (Literally "Limpid Cool Hall," an imperial summer palace).
Kuretake no dai was where planting Wu Chinese bamboo in the eastern garden of Seiryoden (Literally "Limpid Cool Hall," an imperial summer palace).

Wu Chinese bamboo is Henon bamboo.
Wu Chinese bamboo was Henon bamboo.
Wu Chinese bamboo was Henon bamboo.

sen.j: ハチクを井桁のような四角の籬垣(ませがき)の中に植え込んだものである。
sen.e: This is planting Henon bamboo in square shaped short roughly woven fence like grid.
This was what planting Henon bamboo in a grid like square shaped short roughly woven fence.
sen.cmt: is→was と修正しました。what, a を補いました。オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: This was what planting Henon bamboo in a grid like square shaped short roughly woven fence.

sen.j: その位置は、清涼殿額間の北の間の通り、仁寿殿の西方である。
sen.e: It was located on the eastern side of Jijuden (Emperor's Residence Hall) facing Kita no ma hall passage in Gaku no ma hall.
It was located on the western side of Jijuden (Emperor's Residence Hall), facing Kita no ma hall passage in Gaku no ma hall.
sen.cmt: eastern→western （西方）と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: It was located on the western side of Jijuden (Emperor's Residence Hall), facing Kita no ma hall passage in Gaku no ma hall.

sen.j: 「禁秘抄」には、「呉竹 架（ませ）」とあり、また『枕草子』には、「竹のませ」とある。
sen.e: "Kinpisho" (a book written by Emperor Juntoku, which records the history and origin of imperial court ceremonies and sets forth the rules and etiquette for carrying out such ceremonies) describes it as Kuredake no mase and "Makura no soshi" (the Pillow Book) describes it as Take no mase.

Kinpisho' (a book written by the Emperor Juntoku, which records the history and origin of imperial court ceremonies and sets forth the rules and etiquette for carrying out such ceremonies) describes it as 'Kuredake no mase,' and "Makura no soshi" (the Pillow Book) describes it as 'Take no mase.'
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正、補いました。the, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: Kinpisho' (a book written by the Emperor Juntoku, which records the history and origin of imperial court ceremonies and sets forth the rules and etiquette for carrying out such ceremonies) describes it as 'Kuredake no mase,' and "Makura no soshi" (the Pillow Book) describes it as 'Take no mase.'

sen.j: 天徳 (日本)年間、内匠寮が作り、のちに木工寮が掌った。
sen.e: Naishoryo; Takumiryo (the Bureau of Skilled Artisans) built it in 957 and later Mokuryo (Bureau of Carpentry) took charge.
Takumiryo (the Bureau of Skilled Artisans) built it in the Tentoku era, and later Mokuryo (Bureau of Carpentry) took charge.
sen.cmt: Naishoryo; を削除しました。「天徳年間」を修正しました。（ここでは957年とはないため）
sen.e: Takumiryo (the Bureau of Skilled Artisans) built it in the Tentoku era, and later Mokuryo (Bureau of Carpentry) took charge.
